div1.p:
I am happy to inform you that I arived hear on Sunday evening after I left there I come twelve miles the first day and staid with the waggons that night next morning left them and Come on I had a very pleasant trip winding round and over the hills but verny loansome and tiresom when I got hear I found thare road a great deal of fixing to do before I would be properly fixed to go to work theres no Shop. I got them to getting timbers they have the wall up and quit it I have got me a work bench maid and has it render a shelter and a working away as hard as I Can I have not got no handle timber yet when I speak to the overseer about it he dont appear to give me much Salifaction about it I have two hundred beams got out we are looking for mr gorian every day when he Come I think he will have things regalated I am well and tollerable well pleased with the Country but the prices for Clothing is out of the questing they ask $15 for a pair of bots
and evrything else in propotion they charged me eight dollars for holling my tools hear I got them the next wednersday after I got hear we,are akeeping butcherlors hall and live well I want you to write to me and let me know how you all are and when you think you will have soom Castings ready for me thare is a small rise in the yellow busher now I want you to send me two or three of your oil stones with the first castings tell mr honsley I think hear would be a very good place for his bissiness
